problem: In a rectangle ABCD, AB = 8 units and BC = 6 units. Point E is on AB such that AE = 2 units. Find the ratio of the area of triangle AEC to the area of rectangle ABCD.
solution: Since E is on AB, triangle AEC and rectangle ABCD share the height from E to DC. The base of triangle AEC is EC = AB - AE = 8 - 2 = 6 units. The area of triangle AEC is $0.5 \times 2 \times 6 = 6$ sq units. The area of rectangle ABCD is $8 \times 6 = 48$ sq units. The ratio of the areas is $6 / 48 = 1 / 8$. \(\boxed{\frac{1}{8}}\)
